attributes.action: Scrap the current school grading system and give us a result out of 100 (%).
attributes.background: Every year we get exam and test results for our children that are seemingly meaningless. The results don't tell us how much of the subject material they have actually learnt. If your child achieves a level 4C in Science, how much of the curriculum do they really know? Half? Three quarters? Who knows
attributes.additional_details: I propose two things: 1) that all tests are graded out of 100% and 2) that individual targets are scrapped. By giving us parents a simple percentage, you will be able to easily see how much of the subject your child actually knows. If they get a result of 65%, you can then decide if that's good enough for their ability or if you want them to work toward a higher grade.

attributes.action: The UK Government to support a joint British bid for the 2030 world cup
attributes.background: Britain has shown itself to be a nation that unites when it comes to sport. In these somewhat divided times a post-Brexit United Kingdom will need to find ways to unite us all and demonstrate that we are outward facing nation. What better way that a joint bid to host the football World Cup?
attributes.additional_details: The English FA mounted an unsuccessful bid to host the recent 2018 World Cup that was awarded to Russia. Whilst there is no doubt that England has the footballing infrastructure to host the tournament the world cup has of course been held in England once before in 1966 and a joint British bid would be something new with the added dimensions of all home nations then qualifying as hosts. As well as Wembley and other English stadia games could be played at Principality and Hampden Park.

attributes.action: To include adult grooming in the Sexual Offences Act 2003.
attributes.background:
Age is arbitrary and anyone can be groomed. 

This could mean an elderly person, someone with a mental health condition or just someone who has their guard down. 

Let's change the legislation to help these victims and stop these heinous acts from continuing.
attributes.additional_details:
'Grooming can be defined as the process that an abuser uses to desensitise someone – to make them less like to reject or report abusive behaviour.'

https://www.survivorsuk.org/question/grooming/

Also use the site for further information.

attributes.action: Create a register of people banned from keeping animals in the UK
attributes.background: Bans on keeping animals are currently unenforcible as no national register exists. This petition argues that a national register should be created listing all individuals who have been convicted of animal cruelty and banned from keeping animals.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see a government website created that breeders and pet shops can use to search a database of people banned from keeping animals this is the only way we  can stop these convicted people from purchasing and possibly neglecting another  animal!

attributes.action: Introduce a national agency to perform detailed 'anti-money laundering' testing
attributes.background:
Anti money laundering (AML) checks are required by banks, and also legal advisers, accountants etc
Given a desire to reduce the UK as a destination for 'dirty money' rules could be tighter
AML checks are hard to carry out meaningfully and are already time consuming
attributes.additional_details:
A single agency could improve on the status quo by:
- removing duplication
- unbiased approach
- removing competitive pressures to cut rigour ('all our other [x] accepted this, why don't you?')
- speeding up transactions by pre-approval
- ability to see full picture of all UK investments when testing source of funds

Scheme could be self-funding by charging fees

Data security:
- replace info being gathered and held by multiple parties
- no need to disclose full details when issuing certificate

attributes.action: To allow Tyler, the Creator back into the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In 2015, Tyler, the Creator (an American rapper) was banned from the United Kingdom on “behaviours unacceptable in the UK.” People make mistakes especially at a young age. What Tyler promotes is music which people adore and has matured as most people do. He's been banned from lyrics he wrote in 2009
attributes.additional_details: Tyler has changed as seen in his new music and album released in 2017, which is appealing to at least many thousands of fans in the United Kingdom and does not promote violence as he does not ever promote or perform those songs. His punishment has been too extreme for someone who has used ill lyrics at a poor time which many other celebrities have used worse. The people of the United Kingdom want to see him perform again.

attributes.action: Ensure the Windrush generation can exercise their right to vote.
attributes.background: People affected by the Windrush debacle have had every right that UK citizens take for granted, including the right to vote. Now that the citizenship issue is being resolved, it is only right and proper to ensure they can exercise their right to vote.

attributes.action: Non transitioned transgender* members of military serve as identified gender
attributes.background: Currently, transgender people must have completed transition to be treated as the gender they identify with. It takes years and years to fully transition, meaning some people may have their dreams of joining the British military destroyed. We should allow people to serve as who they are.
attributes.additional_details: Our country prides itself on tolerance and acceptance of all people, regardless of their sex, race, sexual orientation, religion, but why in the British military do we not accept them for their gender (change). Being treated as someone who you are not can make you feel extremely uncomfortable, dysphoric and could even lead to mental health issues. The UK army has recently had a "This is belonging" campaign, but why don't trans* people belong in their identified gender? Please change this

attributes.action: Please remove age restriction in s3(5) of the British Nationality Act
attributes.background: Our son was denied an application to register as a British citizen because he had just turned 18, and informed by Home Office that his only path to citizenship was settlement / ILR (£2389 + Life in UK test £50) followed by naturalisation (£1330 + £20 for biometrics + £80 citizenship ceremony).
attributes.additional_details: Please remove the age restriction to register as a British citizen in section 3(5) birth abroad to parents who are British by descent but now domiciled in UK. Why does the entitlement under British Nationality law end upon reaching the age of 18? Article 8 / Human Rights Act 1998 and UN Declaration on Human Rights state inter alia "The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State."

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for apprentices to at least £6
attributes.background: Currently the minimum wage for apprentices is £3.70. This means that if an apprentice works 40 hours per week, they will only receive £7,696 a year. This is not enough money to live off and does not provide a big enough incentive for school levers to start work and have a successful career.

attributes.action: Allow on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights.
attributes.background: Allowing on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights would make them more noticeable to other vehicles. This would help minimise delays while they are trying to get to their respective station. Delays cost lives!
attributes.additional_details: Green flashing lights can currently be used by doctors. These lights don't give any exemption to traffic laws, but do highlight the importance of the journey. This means that vehicles are more likely to let them past than if they had no lighting.

attributes.action: Record homeless death statistics at local and national levels
attributes.background: According to the guardian, the number of homeless deaths on Britain’s streets has more than doubled since 2013, yet the extent of the problem is not known as neither the government nor local authorities are required to keep statistics on this. By understanding the problem, it can be better tackled.
attributes.additional_details: On 11 April 2018, Patrick Greenfield and Sarah Marsh wrote in the guardian that the number of homeless people dying on the streets of Britain has more than doubled in recent years, but the true extent of the problem could be much higher as there is no national or locally recorded official statistics measuring this. To better understand and help to tackle this issue, statistics on the number of deaths of homeless people on the streets of Britain should be recorded.

attributes.action: Don't allow councils to use private companies as Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.background: Councils are subcontracting their Enforcement Officers to private companies. It has been highlighted in the news and in a damning panorama report, private companies are out for profit and cannot make the right moral decisions. These powers need to remain with local council Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39882434

attributes.action: Invite Vladimir Putin to the UK to discuss UK-Russia relations
attributes.background:
Britain's most famous Prime Minister Winston Churchill said "Jaw Jaw is better than War War". 
If he refuses to come it will speak volumes. If he does come maybe we can avert a tit-for-tat escalation.

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.

attributes.action: Write off all the student loans up to the current academic year.
attributes.background:
All student loans are mis-sold. The main reasons are:
Lack of information provided at the time of agreement i.e. interest rates and the term of the loan.
No information or support provided during the term of the loan.
No communication provided after the course ended on how much is owed.
attributes.additional_details:
Student loans have been a huge scam, pulling in students by millions and selling them an idea of a cheap loan. All the loans should be written off, new regulations and guidelines should put into place from next academic year so students know what they are getting themselves into.There is a serious breach of duty of care which the government owes to us all as the loans are provided by the government.
https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/jun/04/student-loans-really-were-mis-sold

attributes.action: Ban diesel cars, post-Brexit
attributes.background: Diesel NOx cheating kills 23,500 UK people a year prematurely, at 10 times the USA’s gun death rate. The UK cannot wait 23 years and see 540,500 die early. We must follow the Germans and ban diesels immediately Post-Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Last July, the UK banned diesel cars by 2040, because EU diesel testing failure had worsened breaching of NOx targets. Many German cities exceed EU limits. So, last February, Germany’s highest court ruled that cities can ban the worst diesels.

Car makers and politicians move between both spheres in Germany, the major EU budget contributor. It got EU CO2 regulations to favour diesel, ignoring NOx. VW cheated on emission testing. With 3 jailed, police are investigating 3 of VW’s top people.

attributes.action: Disallow Schools To Confiscate Mobile Phones
attributes.background: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate items such as mobile phones. Mobile Phone are necessary to a child's learning, it lets the student to enhance the internet, release stress, contacts friends for social support and let's parents and carers now where their child is and if they are ok.
attributes.additional_details: Yes, Phones can be a distraction meaning students must not use them in class but a teacher must not confiscate them. What are students suppose to do if they are in trouble walking home? What if they need to go to a friend's due to an emergency? What if the parent needs to contact the child but does not know where they are and who to ring?

attributes.action: Changes required under the Universal Credit to support workers!
attributes.background:
make uploading documentation for childcare costs or any other evidence available online - this will enable working families to upload in a timely manner!

monies to be paid in advance for childcare costs as ALL nurseries UK wide require advance payment!!
attributes.additional_details: I am a single mother to 2 under 3's who works as a manager but is newly single and having to rely on a system whether the childcare costs and housing costs have not been paid for the last 2 months leaving me in a very difficult situation that nobody else (IN WORK) SHOULD GO THROUGH!

attributes.action: Make two modest but sensible precautions in case Brexit goes badly.
attributes.background:
Precaution 1.  Hold a post-Brexit referendum on whether to return to the EU.  

Precaution 2.  Ensure our Brexit Terms include the right for a "fast-track" return of the UK to the EU, ideally under pre-Brexit conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
If that new shirt doesn’t quite fit, we can return it to the shop.  To make sure we don’t lose those precious family photos, we back-up the laptop from time to time. 

So if rights-of-return and back-up plans make sense for an individual, shouldn't a nation of 65 million people have a contingency plan just in case Brexit is not the resounding success we all hope for?

No-one on either side of the argument has a crystal ball, so can we afford not to have an insurance policy in our back pocket?

attributes.action: Stop introducing fixed tenancies to tenants
attributes.background: New legislation is putting forward that fixed term tenancies will be given to everyone who is signing a new tenancy. This means tenants with existing secure tenancies will loose their secure tenancy example through mutual exchange and through the bidding system.
attributes.additional_details: Tenants are given opportunity to move through mutual exchange and being forced to give up their secure tenancy because they need extra space or to downsize. Now it’s a choice of quality of living or a secure tenancy. With these new laws coming in no one is secure people with vulnerability should be excempt from these laws. It would be better that those who need to move through mutual exchange should keep their existing tenancy status ie secure tenancy and move that over to the swapper property.

attributes.action: Privatise the NHS.
attributes.background: The privatisation of the NHS would mean taxes could be cut immensely or go to other areas. The privatisation would save money for the people as it will create more competition in the private market forcing lower prices for the competitive advantage of having cheaper care for the people.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS costs the average person £5,000 per year in taxes; the average person goes to the doctor's 4 times per year. If this was privatised then you would pay roughly £50 per visit, which is £200 per year. (This is based off American prices converted to pounds.) That is a lot of money to be saved per person. This extra money could grant lower taxes or more money going to other areas.

attributes.action: Stop 'Treatment Without Consent' in the Mental Health Act
attributes.background: If patients with physical illnesses such as cancer can refuse treatment mental health patients should also be able to do the same. The current practice of using the Mental Health Act to force treatment is coercive and a violation of the autonomy of the patient.
attributes.additional_details: The current practice of psychiatry is almost exclusively based on a biochemical model. The outcome of this is that medication is seen as the only credible resort when treating patients suffering from psychotic illness. When patients suffer side effects they are seen as non-compliant and when they stop medication they are placed on CTOs. This violates the patient's autonomy to make decisions for themselves about their treatment.

attributes.action: Re-run the appointments process for the board of the Office for Students
attributes.background: The Commissioner for Public Appointments has identified serious governance failings and political interference in the appointment of board members of the new Office for Students. All board members should be asked to immediately resign and the appointments process be re-run in  proper manner.
attributes.additional_details: The full report of the Commissioner can be accessed here: https://publicappointmentscommissioner.independent.gov.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Commissioner-for-Public-Appointments-Investigation-OFS-Final-.pdf

attributes.action: Allow non-UK citizens to vote in general elections after 5 years of UK residence
attributes.background: We want all non-EU/non-commonwealth citizens living in the UK to have full voting rights (including in general elections) after 5 years of residence. In order to create a truly representative government we must include the opinions of these people who make up approximately 8% of the UK population.
attributes.additional_details: I recently discovered that non-EU citizens are ineligible to vote in UK general elections, and on further research that non-commonwealth citizens have no voting rights at all. It seems wrong that people who have lived and worked in the UK for a considerable period have no say in their futures. There has been a drastic increase in hate crimes towards foreigners in the UK since the Brexit vote, and making them more a part of our society can only help to make them feel more welcome.

attributes.action: Ban credit cards being used for gambling.
attributes.background: Gambling effects many people,  causes anxiety, depression and can lead to suicide. By banning using credit cards for gambling it ensures anyone who is gambling has the money to do so.

attributes.action: Change the Yellow Box Junction Law to allow motorist to wait for upto 20 seconds
attributes.background:
The law is being misused by Local Councils as a business by installing more cameras and Yellow box junctions and generate millions by issuing tickets for few seconds.
A 20 second exemption should be given  to wait due to unavoidable circumstances and, also in the event no obstruction is caused.
attributes.additional_details: The intention of Honourable MPs for the Yellow Box junction law were not to generate money but to ensure smooth flow of traffic from the right in the event of heavy traffic on the main road. If the council were not stopped they will also convert KEEP CLEAR and T- Junctions into Yellow box junctions and will install CCTV to generate millions.

attributes.action: Police officers should be allowed spit hoods as part of their kit.
attributes.background: At the moment police officers can only use a spit hood in the custody footprint ie in the yard, cage or in custody. Imagine having to do a hospital guard for 8 hours with someone spitting at you and constantly threatening to spit at you.
attributes.additional_details: There are significant health risks through spitting a Ukrainian police officer contracted tuberculosis in 2016 and died. You are also at risk of hep b and hep c as well as cold and flu viruses.

attributes.action: Make booking fees illegal where tickets are only available from one vendor
attributes.background: Ticketing websites regularly charge customers the added cost of a booking fee when using their services despite it often being only website on which tickets are available. This enables vendors to charge whatever price they want knowing if people want the tickets they must pay the charge.
attributes.additional_details: When using sites such as Ticketmaster there is the added cost of a booking fee with the purchase of tickets. In many cases the ticket is only available from this website allowing a monopoly over their sale, this in turn leaves customers open to exploitation as vendors can charge excessive booking fees under this monopoly. Under this proposal booking fees would be banned unless tickets for the same event were on sale elsewhere creating competition among ticket vendors to offer the best price.

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for using physical violence or brandishing weapons.
attributes.background: On a regular basis my colleagues and I are subjected to physical aggression and attacked in the course of our lawful duty. We want minimum custodial sentences brought in so when we are attacked in our workplace or have weapons brandished against us we will have confidence in the justice system.
attributes.additional_details:
On 3 seperate occasions I personally have had knives pulled on me during the execution of warrants issued by HMCTS. On 2 occasions the police refused to arrest as they said there is no point and on the 1 occasion they did the offended was issued a £50.00 fine (which they never paid) with no other punishment at all. 

This is a story that is all too common in our workplace and I feel a minimum sentence should be introduced to provide justice to all frontline workers attacked or threatened.

attributes.action: more funding for schools to tackle mental health issues in staff and students.
attributes.background: We want schools to gain more access to mental health facilities that can greatly benefit their staff and students. Many people suffer in silence because of the lack of support that they can get, we want to change this to make sure that nobody suffers alone. This may include onsite counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health can change the way in which you take in information and how you perform in your daily life. This can affect the way that staff will teach and how the students make progress in their examinations. Mental health issues can often lead to you not doing mandatory things such as eating and getting enough sleep, these are very important factors needed to continue a healthy lifestyle.

attributes.action: Ban the riding of bicycles while walking dogs.
attributes.background: On a regular basis, I see people riding a bicycle while they take their dog for a walk. This is highly dangerous if the dog wants to stop to do their business as on many occasions, the rider is not even paying attention to their dog, which could cause severe injury to the dog.

attributes.action: Increase Child Benefit to £40 per child per week
attributes.background: There are 4.1 Million children in poverty in the UK. And another new 753 children fall in to poverty each day. The best way to tackle it is by increasing child benefits, so this will not prevent people from getting in to work, getting better jobs or better salaries as there is no taper rate for CB.
attributes.additional_details:
67% of children in poverty are from working families. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-39291999
http://www.cpag.org.uk/content/child-poverty-facts-and-figures

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poverty_in_the_United_Kingdom#Poverty_in_the_UK_in_the_21st_century

https://www.google.co.uk/search?ei=m9U8W8DoGYuvgQb-6Z_IAg&q=how+to+end+poverty+in+uk+by+increasing+child+benefit+to+%C2%A340+per+week&oq=how+to+end+poverty+in+uk+by+increasing+child+benefit+to+%C2%A340+per+week&gs_l=psy-ab.3...10100.19683.0.20219.16.16.0.0.0.0.96.903.16.16.0....0...1c.1.64.psy-ab..0.4.241...33i160k1.0.mWs7Ge3vIsw&safe=active&ssui=on

attributes.action: Remove the 'minimum ban' on drink drivers and replace with a lifetime ban
attributes.background:
Currently the law in the UK states that drink driving offenders MAY GET, 6 months’ imprisonment, 
an unlimited fine, a driving ban for at least 1 year (3 years if convicted twice in 10 years)
attributes.additional_details:
These dangerous people should be taken off the road for good and the penalties for those who offend should be a lot stricter. An example must be made.
Almost 1 in 4 drink driving offenders return to court for the same offence in the UK.

attributes.action: Build animal bridges over country roads to stop them being killed in the 1000's
attributes.background: Living in the countryside it breaks my heart to see dead birds, deer, foxes, rabbits and badgers dead on the road. Animals just trying to live in a world that we have added thousands of cars to. They are being punished by humans. We already rule the world. Save the wildlife while there's time
attributes.additional_details: A65 is a prime example of this in Cumbria. Every single day there is a dead animal on this road. And most other roads around these parts. It's disgusting how we destroy every we touch let alone what we are doing to the animals. Finding a half dead mangled deer at the side of the road and having to put it out of its misery is the worst thing I've had to do and it's not the first one. Please get on board

attributes.action: Re-skill ALL shop floor workers who have been made redundant in 2018 onwards.
attributes.background: Around 30,000 jobs have been lost or at risk since Jan 1 2018. The British Retail Consortium are predicting that up to 1m jobs could be lost or at risk by 2020 in UK Retailing. Every shop worker should be given FREE training to start a new digital career in online retailing.

attributes.action: Change CMS from GROSS pay back to NET pay and don't include a fathers overtime.
attributes.background: The child support agency (CSA) has changed over to the child maintainance service (CMS) and in doing so it has changed calculations from NET PAY to GROSS PAY costing dads anywhere from £50 extra per month to 200+ extra per month, as these new calculations also include overtime.
attributes.additional_details: Also take into account the mental state this can have on a father. We are trying to prevent problems, not create more.

attributes.action: Make dementia training mandatory within the NHS and hospitals.
attributes.background: Help me change how people living with dementia can have a better quality of care when visiting the hospital and being treated by staff with very little or no experience and  knowledge of the disease and also help the staff to better their knowledge and understanding of dementia.
attributes.additional_details: Elderly lady living with dementia in a care home setting had a fall as was taken to A & E due to NHS staff ( GP's, OT's, Radiographers and nurses ) lack of understanding and knowledge of dementia. She was sedated unnecessarily as they said she was a risk to herself.

attributes.action: Establish quorum and meaningful majority criteria to validate future referenda.
attributes.background: Referendums are affecting the future of the UK. A 50.1% majority is slight and have left nearly half the electorate unsatisfied and discontented. Criteria such as the definition of a quorum would establish the initial validity of the referendum and more accurately reflect the will of the electorate.

attributes.action: Allow the practice of euthanasia in the UK.
attributes.background: Euthanasia should be a human right for those who need and deserve the right to die. No human being deserves to suffer from an illness with no potential for recovery. It should be a choice for all critically unwell individuals if they wish to be euthanised.
attributes.additional_details:
In dire circumstances, it should be available for UK citizens to have the choice or their families to have the choice for an ill individual to die with dignity, to end suffering for the person of ill health. 
In the UK under ASPA (Animals : Scientific Procedures Act) 1986, there is a requirement to euthanise animals in order to prevent undue suffering. If this is legally viewed as a right and a requirement for mice, rats etc. why not for humans?

attributes.action: Mobility scooters users should be licenced, insured and pass a handling test.
attributes.background: To help prevent more members of the general public being injured, as i was recently, by one of these large, heavy, unregulated vehicles driven without due care in public places.

attributes.action: Change Abortion law to a period of 12 weeks instead of 24 weeks.
attributes.background: The Irish are proposing to introduce legislation that will restrict Category C abortions to 12 weeks, whilst we continue to allow abortions up to 24 weeks - far beyond the time when a baby can survive outside the womb.  This needs changed.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017 there were 194,668 legal abortions carried out in England & Wales (ie just over 745 abortions per working day). Of these, 98% (185,448) were carried out under category C. Of these, 99.5% were reported as being performed because of a risk to the woman’s mental health. In 13 cases, an abortion was performed under category C because of complications of pregnancy. Source - Abortion Statistics, England and Wales: 2017, Department of Health & Social Care

attributes.action: Make high blood pressure tablets free on the NHS
attributes.background: Over 5 million people have high blood pressure and it affects more than 1 in 4 adults and is one of the biggest risk factors for premature death and disability in England.High blood pressure can lead to diseases including heart disease, stroke, vascular dementia and chronic kidney disease.
attributes.additional_details: People who treat their diabetes with tablets, injection therapies or insulin are entitled to free prescriptions – but if you're in England you'll need to have a medical exemption certificate to claim your free prescription unless you're aged 60 or over. High blood pressure affects more people and have the same potential to kill a sufferer as someone with diabetes. High blood pressure sufferers right across the UK should be treated equally and fairly as diabetics and get free medication

attributes.action: Year 10 & Year 11 students should focus on GCSEs and not have to do PE.
attributes.background: Secondary schools are forcing children in year 10 and year 11 to do PE (physical education), in other words sports. It should be a choice at GCSE to do PE. If the student has chosen Sports as a GCSE then they should do PE however if students did not pick Sports they should not be forced to do PE!
attributes.additional_details: Children should be focusing on their GCSEs and achieving high grades which will help further along in the education system, yet secondary schools are forcing children to do PE. Other subject will benefit the children more such as math. If the child is doing an average of 1 hour of PE a week, over the course of 39 weeks (average school year) it comes to a total of 78 hours from year 10-11. Definitely too many hours. This can be split up for other lessons which will help support the child better.

attributes.action: The N.H.S should fund properly regulated homeopathy clinics.
attributes.background: Millions around the world and in the U.K choose homeopathy instead of mainstream medicine, until recently the N.H.S funded some G.P's who prescribed homeopathic remedy's but the N.H.S has now stopped this.

attributes.action: Make it law that people have to vote, same as Australia
attributes.background: Make it law in the UK that people have to vote unless they have a legitimate reason not to. If they don't vote and don't have a legitimate reason then they should get fined.
attributes.additional_details: This needs to happen as the amount of people who do vote is appalling and numbers need to rise.

attributes.action: Raise Awarness for Morgellons Disease and co infections eg: Lymes Disease
attributes.background: I was bitten by a tick in the uk in 2011 I didn’t seek treatment as I didn’t no the risks. I was very ill over a number of years losing my hair etc. It was only when fibres started to come from my skin that I was diagnosed with Morgellons Disease a chronic form of Lymes Disease caused by the tick
attributes.additional_details: I am now under treatment but can’t be cured. Yet this Disease is still not recognised as a genuine illness as over the years patients have been dismissed as being dillusional. I am under a Dermatologist at the Royal London Hospital. Who states this is not a dillusion! The Disease needs listing on the rare disease register

attributes.action: Attach a mandatory Prison term to every charged Drink Driving case
attributes.background: Charged Drink Driving offences rarely carry any prison sentence and those with the money can easily afford any fine or ban. Adding a mandatory jail sentence should again make people think twice regardless of their status.
attributes.additional_details: Celebrities getting off with just fines and bans.

attributes.action: Extend the remit of Employment Tribunals to include all equality-related cases
attributes.background: Employment Tribunals should become Employment & Equality Tribunals and hear all equality-related cases. Why have an Equality Act if only employees have access to legal redress? The Government must ensure that everyone, including pensioners and students, has equal access to justice at equal cost.
attributes.additional_details: The additional burden on the tribunal system would be small compared with the huge difference the change would make to those suffering breaches of the law. If the government won't extend the remit, they must explain why disabled students have fewer rights than disabled employees. An employee with a discrimination claim can go to the tribunal, but if someone other than their employer discriminates against them, they have to file an expensive claim in the County Court or the High Court.

attributes.action: Legally require the Net Internal Floor area to be quoted for every home on sale.
attributes.background: Homes in Britain are traded in terms of rooms rather than floor space. This lack of clear information is a source of market failure. British homes are getting more cramped and less fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: There are no minimum space standards for new housing in Britain. Research by CABE and LABC Warranty shows that developers are making homes smaller and smaller. New homes lack space for family meals, for childrens play and homework, and for storage. Quoting the Net Internal Floor area (e.g. as defined by the Valuation Office Agency) would help buyers understand exactly what they are getting, make objective comparisons, and identify value for money.
